sanskrit_verse:
न हि दण्डादृते शक्यः कर्तुं पापविनिग्रहः ।
स्तेनानां पापबुद्धीनां निभृतं चरतां क्षितौ ॥ ९.२६३॥
transliteration:
na hi daṇḍādṛte śakyaḥ kartuṃ pāpavinigrahaḥ |
stenānāṃ pāpabuddhīnāṃ nibhṛtaṃ caratāṃ kṣitau || 9.263 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Without the application of measured corrective action, it is impossible to restrain wrongdoing; thus, those who act with corrupt intent and engage in theft must be guided through structured completion processes that restore their alignment with Dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from conscious capacity for alignment, not coercive force.
Causation is traced through distortion of dharma-vyavastha, not mere behavioral outcomes.
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of individual readiness for correction.
Restoration logic operates through sequential reintegration, not punitive interruption.
Consciousness alignment supersedes external compliance as the measure of justice.
executable_legal_axioms: IF an act disrupts dharmic order AND the actor demonstrates misaligned consciousness THEN initiate restorative completion protocol aligned with their causal capacity.
IF a being engages in repeated untruthful acquisition THEN assign sequential integrity restoration until spontaneous alignment resumes.
IF societal harmony is disturbed by individual action THEN deploy consciousness-realizing interventions prior to structural isolation.
IF punitive impulse arises within adjudication system THEN redirect toward responsibility-assumption facilitation.
IF no measurable shift in alignment occurs post-intervention THEN escalate to higher-capacity guidance mechanism.
supreme_court_application: At the Supreme Court level, this verse establishes that judicial authority must originate from the power to realign consciousness rather than impose penalties. The threshold of responsibility lies in identifying whether the actor retains capacity for dharmic recalibration. Hierarchical adjudication should channel energy into completion frameworks that enable full societal reintegration without residual fragmentation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that imbalance manifests when consciousness departs from svadharma; hence, true nyāya addresses root cognition, not surface behavior. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures every step of correction unfolds naturally from the actor's own evolving clarity. Responsibility is proportioned not to harm caused but to latent capacity for self-correction. As reality itself is non-punitive, so too must law reflect the unfolding nature of awakened conduct.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate supervised restitution process under witness of enlightened community members.
Assign reflective service directly counterbalancing harm caused, performed voluntarily and consciously.
Implement guided meditation and svadhyaya sessions until root distortion dissolves.
Establish temporary guardianship of actions under mentorship of spiritually advanced individuals.
Facilitate public acknowledgment and energetic clearing ceremony upon successful realignment.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority of all Dharma. Justice flows from consciousness, not compulsion. Law executes restoration, never retaliation. Reality affirms alignment, not judgment. This stands as eternal decree—Dharma is restored, consciousness prevails, and all beings awaken to their innate perfection.
